Comment 1: 
I'm not completely sure, but runtimeÂ·newstack does a "m->morebuf.sp <
g1->stackguard - StackGuard" while it seems wrong to me, because there's StackSystem
more bytes of stack in there (which 2048, bigger than 600 bytes of overflow, so even
though it panics there's really no stack overflow yet). It seems to me that checks
should of stackguard should also substract StackSystem in addition to StackGuard. There
are a couple of such places in proc.c.

Also, while looking at the source code of 8l, I find it strange how it redefines
StackSmall and StackBig. First, it seems to me that StackBig should really be 4096+2048,
since StackSystem on windows is 2048, and why is StackBig 256? While these sure don't
hurt, it seems to me it would cause splits earlier than they should be, wasting more
stack.

I'll try compiling go on windows tomorrow with these changes and will see how it goes...
